pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:5.1: 86. The training rule on ornamentations of the hip
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:6.2: At that time a nun was associating with the family of a certain woman.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:6.3: That woman said to that nun,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:6.4: “Venerable, please give this hip ornament to such-and-such a woman.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:6.6: “If I carry it in my bowl, I will get into trouble,” and so she put it on and then left.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:6.7: While she was walking along a street the threads broke, and they were strewn all over.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:6.9: “How can nuns wear hip ornaments? They are just like lay people who indulge in sensual pleasures.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:7.1: The nuns heard the complaints of those people.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:7.2: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:7.3: “How can a nun wear a hip ornament?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:7.4: “Is it true, monks, that a nun did this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:7.7: How can a nun wear a hip ornament?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:7.8: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:7.9: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:8.1: ‘If a nun wears a hip ornament, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:9.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination by both complete Orders through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:11.2: if she wears it even once, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:12.2: if she wears it because she is sick;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:12.5: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:13.1: The third training rule is finished.
